attributes.action: to abandon the Voucher scheme which is currently in place to support asylum seekers in receipt of NASS section 4 support.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This scheme is anti the UK’s ambition to respect Human Dignity, it’s against fair trading, only big businesses i.e. Tesco and Asda  benefit from the scheme, this stops small businesses participating. It’s impractical and causes distress. Vouchers can’t be used at launderettes, or on public transport (people have to walk great distances in order to obtain food and essentials) Participating businesses don’t provide food which is religiously acceptable, and are expensive in terms of items for babies and children. People can’t shop close by or participate in buying from charity shops or accessing recycled goods. Consequently users are in a situation similar to German Jews following the 1938 extension of the Nazi’s Nuremburg laws i.e. recipients of vouchers can’t use public  baths, go to the cinema, or use public transport, they’re  only allowed to use certain shops. This is de-humanising and degrading, it ruins the UK’s good name in terms of human rights, fairness and freedom.
